alert.note: Alert for Northern Litchfield; Southern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Litchfield County through 500 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Litchfield, or 11 miles southwest of Torrington, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Torrington, New Milford, Thomaston, New Hartford, Litchfield, Northwest Harwinton, Oakville, Terryville, New Hartford Center, Woodbury Center, Gaylordsville, New Preston, Winsted, Watertown, Plymouth, Woodbury, Harwinton, Barkhamsted, Bethlehem, and Washington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
